page.title: 08JUBILEE HOSPITAL HUNTLY
page.content: The Jubilee Hospital was opened in 1888. Today it houses a Cottage Hospital, a Maternity wing and the town's Health Centre. There are 4 wards; 2 surgical(male /female) and 2 medical(male/female). There are 64 nurses(staff) and the 4 local doctors attend patients. If operations are done the surgeon travels from Aberdeen. The 4 doctors consult in the Health Centre using the appointment system, but they can be called out to your home. The Maternity wing is a separate building because it was opened in 1890 as an isolation fever unit. It consists of a 1 ward of 6 beds and other necessary rooms and nurseries. 17 babies have been born there this year already and they provide post-natal care for mothers who choose to have their babies in Aberdeen.
